CatDescriptText: Roosevelt Thomas, janitor, 1033 Hall Street, and Margie Beck, telephone operator, McKees Rocks, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, March 26, 1960, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think the Federal Government should intervene in the student sit-down demonstrations?"  Mr. Thomas' answer reads: "It should.  There is no other law for the students to turn to."  Ms. Beck's answer reads: "It should not.  Let the people in each area settle the problems themselves."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Roosevelt Thomas wearing moustache, light colored fedora, and plaid tie, standing in front of C.A. Michel store with Pittsburgh Paints sign, Smithfield Street, Downtown; Portrait of Margie Beck wearing dark coat and light colored scarf, standing in front of C.A. Michel store with Pittsburgh Paints sign, Smithfield Street, Downtown
